types.name: Cycle
types.description: A set of issues to be resolved in a specified amount of time.

fields.name: archivedAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was archived. Null if the entity has not been archived.

fields.name: autoArchivedAt
fields.description: The time at which the cycle was automatically archived by the auto pruning process.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: The completion time of the cycle. If null, the cycle hasn't been completed.

fields.name: completedIssueCountHistory
fields.description: The number of completed issues in the cycle after each day.

fields.name: completedScopeHistory
fields.description: The number of completed estimation points after each day.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was created.

fields.description: [Internal] The current progress of the cycle.

fields.description: The end time of the cycle.

fields.description: The unique identifier of the entity.

fields.name: inProgressScopeHistory
fields.description: The number of in progress estimation points after each day.

fields.name: inheritedFrom
fields.description: The cycle inherited from.

fields.name: isActive
fields.description: Whether the cycle is currently active.

fields.name: isFuture
fields.description: Whether the cycle is in the future.

fields.name: isNext
fields.description: Whether the cycle is the next cycle for the team.

fields.name: isPast
fields.description: Whether the cycle is in the past.

fields.name: isPrevious
fields.description: Whether the cycle is the previous cycle for the team.

fields.name: issueCountHistory
fields.description: The total number of issues in the cycle after each day.

fields.name: issues
fields.description: Issues associated with the cycle.

args.name: after
args.description: A cursor to be used with first for forward pagination

args.name: before
args.description: A cursor to be used with last for backward pagination.

args.name: filter
args.description: Filter returned issues.

args.name: first
args.description: The number of items to forward paginate (used with after). Defaults to 50.

args.name: includeArchived
args.description: Should archived resources be included (default: false)

args.name: last
args.description: The number of items to backward paginate (used with before). Defaults to 50.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: By which field should the pagination order by. Available options are createdAt (default) and updatedAt.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The custom name of the cycle.

fields.name: number
fields.description: The number of the cycle.

fields.name: progress
fields.description: The overall progress of the cycle. This is the (completed estimate points + 0.25 * in progress estimate points) / total estimate points.

fields.name: progressHistory
fields.description: [Internal] The progress history of the cycle.

fields.name: scopeHistory
fields.description: The total number of estimation points after each day.

fields.name: startsAt
fields.description: The start time of the cycle.

fields.name: team
fields.description: The team that the cycle is associated with.

fields.name: uncompletedIssuesUponClose
fields.description: Issues that weren't completed when the cycle was closed.

types.description: Represents a date and time in ISO 8601 format. Accepts shortcuts like `2021` to represent midnight Fri Jan 01 2021. Also accepts ISO 8601 durations strings which are added to the current date to create the represented date (e.g '-P2W1D' represents the date that was two weeks and 1 day ago)

types.name: DateTimeOrDuration

inputFields.description: The identifier of the user to assign the issue to.

inputFields.description: The date when the issue was completed (e.g. if importing from another system). Must be a date in the past and after createdAt date. Cannot be provided with an incompatible workflow state.

inputFields.description: Create issue as a user with the provided name. This option is only available to OAuth applications creating issues in `actor=app` mode.

inputFields.description: The date when the issue was created (e.g. if importing from another system). Must be a date in the past. If none is provided, the backend will generate the time as now.

inputFields.description: [Internal] The issue description as a Prosemirror document.

inputFields.description: Provide an external user avatar URL. Can only be used in conjunction with the `createAsUser` options. This option is only available to OAuth applications creating comments in `actor=app` mode.

inputFields.name: dueDate
inputFields.description: The date at which the issue is due.

inputFields.name: estimate
inputFields.description: The estimated complexity of the issue.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The identifier in UUID v4 format. If none is provided, the backend will generate one.

inputFields.description: The identifiers of the issue labels associated with this ticket.

inputFields.name: preserveSortOrderOnCreate
inputFields.description: Whether the passed sort order should be preserved.

inputFields.description: The priority of the issue. 0 = No priority, 1 = Urgent, 2 = High, 3 = Normal, 4 = Low.

inputFields.name: prioritySortOrder
inputFields.description: The position of the issue related to other issues, when ordered by priority.

inputFields.name: projectId
inputFields.description: The project associated with the issue.

inputFields.name: projectMilestoneId
inputFields.description: The project milestone associated with the issue.

inputFields.name: referenceCommentId

inputFields.description: [Internal] The timestamp at which the issue's SLA was started.

inputFields.description: The identifier of a template the issue should be created from. If other values are provided in the input, they will override template values.

inputFields.name: title

inputFields.description: Whether to use the default template for the team. When set to true, the default template of this team based on user's membership will be applied.

types.name: Organization
types.description: An organization. Organizations are root-level objects that contain user accounts and teams.

fields.description: [INTERNAL] Whether the organization has enabled the AI add-on (which at this point only includes triage suggestions).

fields.name: aiDiscussionSummariesEnabled
fields.description: Whether the organization has enabled AI discussion summaries for issues.

fields.name: aiThreadSummariesEnabled
fields.description: Whether the organization has enabled resolved thread AI summaries.

fields.name: allowMembersToInvite
fields.description: [DEPRECATED] Whether member users are allowed to send invites.

fields.name: allowedAiProviders
fields.description: [INTERNAL] Permitted AI providers in order of preference. Empty array means all providers are allowed.

fields.name: allowedAuthServices
fields.description: Allowed authentication providers, empty array means all are allowed.

fields.name: allowedFileUploadContentTypes
fields.description: Allowed file upload content types

fields.name: archivedAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was archived. Null if the entity has not been archived.

fields.name: codeIntelligenceEnabled
fields.description: [INTERNAL] Whether code intelligence is enabled for the organization.

fields.name: codeIntelligenceRepository
fields.description: [INTERNAL] GitHub repository in owner/repo format for code intelligence.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was created.

fields.name: createdIssueCount
fields.description: Aproximate number of issues in the organization, including archived ones.

fields.name: customerCount
fields.description: Number of customers in the organization.

fields.name: customersConfiguration
fields.description: Configuration settings for the Customers feature.

fields.description: Whether the organization is using Customers.

fields.name: defaultFeedSummarySchedule
fields.description: Default schedule for how often feed summaries are generated.

fields.name: deletionRequestedAt
fields.description: The time at which deletion of the organization was requested.

fields.name: facets
fields.description: [Internal] Facets associated with the organization.

fields.name: feedEnabled
fields.description: Whether the organization has enabled the feed feature.

fields.name: fiscalYearStartMonth
fields.description: The month at which the fiscal year starts. Defaults to January (0).

fields.name: generatedUpdatesEnabled
fields.description: [INTERNAL] Whether the organization has enabled generated updates.

fields.name: gitBranchFormat
fields.description: How git branches are formatted. If null, default formatting will be used.

fields.name: gitLinkbackDescriptionsEnabled
fields.description: Whether issue descriptions should be included in Git integration linkback messages.

fields.name: gitLinkbackMessagesEnabled
fields.description: Whether the Git integration linkback messages should be sent to private repositories.

fields.name: gitPublicLinkbackMessagesEnabled
fields.description: Whether the Git integration linkback messages should be sent to public repositories.

fields.name: hipaaComplianceEnabled
fields.description: Whether HIPAA compliance is enabled for organization.

fields.description: The unique identifier of the entity.

fields.name: initiativeUpdateReminderFrequencyInWeeks
fields.description: The n-weekly frequency at which to prompt for initiative updates. When not set, reminders are off.

fields.description: The day at which to prompt for initiative updates.

fields.name: initiativeUpdateRemindersHour
fields.description: The hour at which to prompt for initiative updates.

fields.name: integrations

types.name: Team
types.description: An organizational unit that contains issues.

fields.name: activeCycle
fields.description: Team's currently active cycle.

fields.name: aiDiscussionSummariesEnabled
fields.description: Whether to enable AI discussion summaries for issues in this team.

fields.name: aiThreadSummariesEnabled
fields.description: Whether to enable resolved thread AI summaries.

fields.name: allMembersCanJoin
fields.description: Whether all members in the workspace can join the team. Only used for public teams.

fields.name: archivedAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was archived. Null if the entity has not been archived.

fields.name: autoArchivePeriod
fields.description: Period after which automatically closed and completed issues are automatically archived in months.

fields.name: autoCloseChildIssues
fields.description: Whether child issues should automatically close when their parent issue is closed

fields.name: autoCloseParentIssues
fields.description: Whether parent issues should automatically close when all child issues are closed

fields.name: autoClosePeriod
fields.description: Period after which issues are automatically closed in months. Null/undefined means disabled.

fields.name: autoCloseStateId
fields.description: The canceled workflow state which auto closed issues will be set to. Defaults to the first canceled state.

fields.name: children
fields.description: [Internal] The team's sub-teams.

fields.name: color
fields.description: The team's color.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which the entity was created.

fields.name: currentProgress
fields.description: [Internal] The current progress of the team.

fields.name: cycleCalenderUrl
fields.description: Calendar feed URL (iCal) for cycles.

fields.name: cycleCooldownTime
fields.description: The cooldown time after each cycle in weeks.

fields.name: cycleDuration
fields.description: The duration of a cycle in weeks.

fields.name: cycleIssueAutoAssignCompleted
fields.description: Auto assign completed issues to current cycle.

fields.name: cycleIssueAutoAssignStarted
fields.description: Auto assign started issues to current cycle.

fields.name: cycleLockToActive
fields.description: Auto assign issues to current cycle if in active status.

fields.name: cycleStartDay
fields.description: The day of the week that a new cycle starts.

fields.name: cycles
fields.description: Cycles associated with the team.

args.name: after
args.description: A cursor to be used with first for forward pagination

args.name: before
args.description: A cursor to be used with last for backward pagination.

args.name: filter
args.description: Filter returned issues.

args.name: first
args.description: The number of items to forward paginate (used with after). Defaults to 50.

args.name: includeArchived
args.description: Should archived resources be included (default: false)

args.name: last
args.description: The number of items to backward paginate (used with before). Defaults to 50.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: By which field should the pagination order by. Available options are createdAt (default) and updatedAt.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The state's name.

fields.name: position
fields.description: The position of the state in the team flow.

fields.name: team
fields.description: The team to which this state belongs to.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the state. One of "triage", "backlog", "unstarted", "started", "completed", "canceled".

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description:
The last time at which the entity was meaningfully updated. This is the same as the creation time if the entity hasn't
    been updated after creation.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
